page.title: 06Cycling in Milton Keynes
page.content: The redways are paths for cyclists and pedestrians only which run throughout Milton Keynes.They are made of red tarmac. Whilst on the redways you may need to cross the road.To help you do this there are underpasses,bridges and bollards.The bollards are yellow posts that warn you there is a road ahead In 1980 there was 150 kilometres of redways running through Milton Keynes, but now much more has been built. On the redways there are signs to direct you.They have green backgrounds and white letters. The redways are much safer than riding on the roads.You have to watch out for pedestrians walking on the redways and broken glass lying around,although they are cleaned regularly.
